references.paper_title: Semi-Supervised Classification with Graph Convolutional Networks
references.reason: This foundational paper introduces graph convolutional networks (GCNs), a crucial architecture for graph neural networks (GNNs) and a key component of many methods discussed.
This paper introduces graph attention networks (GATs), another significant GNN architecture used extensively in graph-based machine learning, offering a valuable alternative to GCNs.

references.paper_title: Inductive Representation Learning on Large Graphs
references.reason: This paper addresses inductive learning on large graphs, an important context for the methods in the current work, proposing the GraphSAGE algorithm which is also compared against.
This introduces the mixup data augmentation technique, which is the core inspiration for IntraMix, but adapted for the complexities of graph data.

references.paper_title: Combining Neural Networks with Personalized PageRank for Classification on Graphs
references.reason: This proposes the APPNP algorithm, which uses personalized PageRank for node classification, a method also employed for comparison.
